docs.snippet: San Antonio’s overheated arena and LeBron James, who missed the final minutes of Game 1 of the N.B.A. finals with leg cramps, were said to be doing better on Friday afternoon....
docs.lead_paragraph: San Antonio’s overheated arena and LeBron James, who missed the final minutes of Game 1 of the N.B.A. finals with leg cramps, were said to be doing better on Friday afternoon.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat star LeBron James is set to return for Game 2 in NBA final series against the San Antonio Spurs after missing final minutes of first game due to leg cramps; malfunctioning air-conditioner at AT&T Center in San Antonio, which contributed to heat-induced cramps, has been repaired.

headline.main: James and Air-Conditioning Are Expected to Return for Game 2
headline.print_headline: James and Air-Conditioning Are Expected to Return for Game 2

docs.snippet: Kentucky gave coach John Calipari a seven-year, $52.5 million contract extension that will pay a base package of $6.5 million next season and $8 million over each of the final three seasons....

docs.snippet: An antitrust trial begins Monday that could upend big-time college sports....
docs.lead_paragraph: An antitrust trial begins Monday that could upend big-time college sports.
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column holds that antitrust lawsuit being filed by former UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon against the NCAA may force association to change culture in which adult coaches get rich at expense of college players; says that while few believe that NCAA protects interests of young athletes, only Congress or courts can force it to change.

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s time fore a really, really interesting talk about tax reform, people! Seriously, Walter White, Olivia Pope, Captain Kirk. They’re all involved.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column compares Republican Rep Dave Camp to the Hobbit in that he has taken on brave quest in search of way to make tax system cleaner and simpler; notes that Camp's first effort, principled proposal that eliminated number of loopholes, was shot down by fellow Republicans; expresses bafflement that Camp responded to rebuke by making number of tax cuts permanent.
